Back to Sergei Rachmaninoff

Sergei Rachmaninoff

Études-tableaux, op. 33

1911

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP]

Total duration: 22' (with 3 and 5) or 14' (without 3 and 5)

  • 1. (1.) F minor
  • 2. (2.) C major
  • 3. C minor
  • 4. A minor
  • 5. D minor
  • 6. (3.) E-flat minor
  • 7. (4.) E-flat major
  • 8. (5.) G minor
  • 9. (6.) C-sharp minor

Rachmaninoff originally wrote nine études-tableaux for this collection, but chose only six (nos. 1–2 and 6–9) for publication. Nos. 3 and 5 were published posthumously, whilst no. 4 is lost, but was revised and published as op. 39 no. 6.

Recommended editions

  • Henle · HN 1202 · Études-Tableaux · ed. Dominik Rahmer
  • Henle · HN 1521 · Études-Tableaux · ed. Dominik Rahmer
  • Russian Music Publishing · 3101/3404 · Etudes-Tableaux · ed. Valentin Antipov [including earlier versions]

1. (1.) F minor

Duration: 2' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

2. (2.) C major

Duration: 2'

Difficulty: 3.5

3. C minor

Duration: 5'

Difficulty: 3.5

4. A minor

This étude is now lost, but was revised as op. 39 no. 6.

5. D minor

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 5

6. (3.) E-flat minor

Duration: 1' 30"

Difficulty: 5

7. (4.) E-flat major

Duration: 1' 30"

Difficulty: 4.5

8. (5.) G minor

Duration: 3' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

9. (6.) C-sharp minor

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 5
